name: Denmark
description: Denmark, officially the Kingdom of Denmark, is a Scandinavian country with a rich history, vibrant culture, and stunning natural landscapes. Known for its design, innovation, and commitment to sustainability, Denmark boasts a unique blend of urban sophistication and rural charm. From the rolling hills of Zealand to the rugged coastline of Jutland, Denmark offers a diverse range of experiences for visitors and residents alike.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Denmark has a relatively small but highly educated and engaged population.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is one of the highest in Europe, largely due to its compact size and urbanized areas.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Copenhagen is a global city renowned for its design, culture, and quality of life.
quickFacts.detail: It's consistently ranked as one of the world's most livable cities.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the landmass is relatively flat, with some rolling hills and coastal plains.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Danish is a North Germanic language.
quickFacts.detail: English is widely spoken and understood, particularly in urban areas.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Danish currency is the Krone.
quickFacts.detail: It's a relatively stable currency within the Eurozone.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Denmark has a high GDP per capita.
quickFacts.detail: It's a developed economy with a strong focus on renewable energy and technology.

climateData.title: Temperate Maritime Climate
climateData.description: Denmark experiences a temperate maritime climate characterized by cool summers and mild winters. The North Sea and Baltic Sea significantly influence the weather, resulting in relatively consistent temperatures and high humidity levels throughout the year.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March-May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming, with blossoming flowers and vibrant greenery. Rainfall is common, and temperatures slowly rise.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June-August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is the warmest and driest season, with long daylight hours and pleasant temperatures. It's a popular time for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September-November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings cooler temperatures and colorful foliage. Rainfall increases, and the days become shorter.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December-February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is the coldest season, with occasional snowfall. Temperatures can drop below freezing, and daylight hours are short.

naturalWonders.name: The Wadden Sea
naturalWonders.description: The Wadden Sea is a unique intertidal ecosystem located along the North Sea coast of Denmark and Germany. It's a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a vital breeding ground for numerous bird species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This dynamic ecosystem is shaped by the tides, creating a series of mudflats, sandbanks, and shallow waters. It's a haven for migratory birds and a crucial part of the North Sea's biodiversity.

naturalWonders.name: Mols Bjerge National Park
naturalWonders.description: Mols Bjerge National Park is a dramatic landscape of rolling hills, heather moorland, and coastal cliffs, offering stunning views and diverse wildlife.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park is characterized by its unique geological formations, shaped by glacial activity. It's home to a variety of plant and animal species, including the Danish heath hen.

naturalWonders.name: The Great Belt
naturalWonders.description: The Great Belt is a large estuary separating Zealand and Funen. It's a vital waterway for shipping and a rich habitat for marine life.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The complex network of channels and islands within the Great Belt creates a diverse range of habitats, supporting a wide variety of fish, birds, and marine mammals. It's a significant area for navigation and recreation.

ecosystemData.title: Danish Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Denmark's ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from coastal wetlands and sandy beaches to extensive forests and moorlands. These ecosystems support a rich variety of plant and animal life, contributing significantly to the country's biodiversity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Denmark's forests cover approximately 25% of the country's land area, providing habitat for a wide range of wildlife and playing a crucial role in carbon sequestration.

statistics.details: Managed for timber production and biodiversity

notableSpecies.name: European Roe Deer
notableSpecies.significance: A key prey species for predators

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: Denmark's coastal wetlands, including mudflats, salt marshes, and sand dunes, are vital habitats for migratory birds and other wildlife.

statistics.details: Important stopover sites for migratory birds

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Denmark
activities.description: Denmark offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels, from hiking and cycling to water sports and wildlife watching.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Denmark's diverse landscapes on foot, from rolling hills to rugged coastlines.

activities.name: Coastal Hiking
activities.description: Hike along the scenic Danish coast, enjoying breathtaking views and diverse wildlife.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, waterproof clothing, map and compass

activities.name: Forest Hiking
activities.description: Discover Denmark's beautiful forests, home to a variety of wildlife and stunning scenery.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports in Denmark's numerous lakes, rivers, and coastal waters.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore Denmark's waterways by kayak, discovering hidden coves and enjoying the tranquility of nature.

activities.name: Surfing
activities.description: Catch some waves on Denmark's Atlantic coast.
